claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.
explanation: A two-panel figure showing the proportion of subjects with ≥4-fold increase in hemagglutination inhibition (HI) titers to cell- or egg-derived vaccine viruses, measured before (Pre) and after (Post) vaccination, in age groups 18–44 years (Panel A) and 45–64 years (Panel B). Responses are shown for four influenza strains (A/H3N2, A/H1N1pdm09, B/Victoria, B/Yamagata) across seven prime-boost vaccine regimens: cell-culture quadrivalent (ccIIV4) and recombinant quadrivalent (RIV4, i.e. Flublok) in various sequences, egg-based IIV4, and Fluzone IIV4. Data points and lines connect Pre/Post values for each regimen with p-values indicated for select comparisons. The figure presents immunogenicity results for various vaccine sequences but does not report or compare the actual hemagglutinin antigen content of Flublok versus standard-dose vaccines; therefore it does not support the claim about Flublok containing three times the HA antigen content. Note: Limited to what is visible; antigen dose information is not provided in this figure.
